name: Claro Robusto
additionalNotes:
I found this cigar in Costa Rica.
Originally made for the Lavida Habana (LH) Cigar Lounges in the Middle East for Princes and Sheiks, these fine cigars are now offered in the US by Nick Syris and Omar Nasr.   I smoked a 5x52 called the Claro. The Claro has a very smooth, sweet wrapper of Ecuardorian Connecticut Shade. It had an inviting pre-light scent of honey.   Time smoked 80 minutes,  Medium body, with floral flavors, nuts, spices and coffee.  They are available in 5”x 52, 5 1/2” x 55, 6” x 60.  Also available are Ecuadorian Habano wrappers and  Ecuadorian Criollo wrappers. The Claro had solid construction with a long ash, no burn issues.  Made in Costa Rica, found in B&M’s @ $8.00
